source:
export type ConsciousnessQuote = {
  text: string
  author: string
  source?: string
  year?: string
  context?: string
}

export const consciousnessQuotes: ConsciousnessQuote[] = [
  {
    text: 'Nothing in biology makes sense except in the light of evolution.',
    author: 'Theodosius Dobzhansky',
    source: 'Nothing in Biology Makes Sense Except in the Light of Evolution',
    year: '1973',
    context: 'Grounds consciousness research in evolutionary biology, reminding us that cognition is an adaptive trait shaped by survival pressures.'
  },
  {
    text: 'The Transformer architecture relies entirely on self-attention mechanisms.',
    author: 'Ashish Vaswani et al.',
    source: 'Attention Is All You Need',
    year: '2017',
    context: 'Defines the neural architecture that unlocked modern large language models and their emergent behaviors.'
  },
  {
    text: 'The brain is wider than the sky.',
    author: 'Emily Dickinson',
    source: 'Poem F633',
    year: 'c. 1862',
    context: 'Poetic reminder that subjective experience can feel boundless compared to the physical world.'
  },
  {
    text: 'We are not thinking machines. We are feeling machines that think.',
    author: 'Antonio Damasio',
    source: 'Descartes\' Error',
    year: '1994',
    context: 'Highlights the inseparability of affect and cognition in human decision-making.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.',
    author: 'Stephen Hawking',
    year: '1990',
    context: 'Frames intelligence as adaptive capacity—central to aligning AI with shifting human needs.'
  },
  {
    text: 'You don\'t understand anything until you learn it more than one way.',
    author: 'Marvin Minsky',
    source: 'Society of Mind',
    year: '1986',
    context: 'Encourages multi-modal learning, mirroring the ensemble of perspectives behind Aggie.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Learning is not the product of teaching. Learning is the product of the activity of learners.',
    author: 'John Holt',
    source: 'How Children Learn',
    year: '1967',
    context: 'Centers agency and participation—key to gathering ethical human data.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Nothing in life is as important as you think it is, while you are thinking about it.',
    author: 'Daniel Kahneman',
    source: 'Thinking, Fast and Slow',
    year: '2011',
    context: 'Warns about cognitive bias, reminding us to design reflective AI systems.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Cogito, ergo sum.',
    author: 'René Descartes',
    source: 'Discourse on the Method',
    year: '1637',
    context: 'Introduces self-reflection as a foundation for consciousness studies.'
  },
  {
    text: 'What is it like to be a bat?',
    author: 'Thomas Nagel',
    source: 'The Philosophical Review',
    year: '1974',
    context: 'Challenges reductive views by foregrounding subjective experience as irreducible.'
  },
  {
    text: 'The hard problem of consciousness is the question of how physical processes in the brain give rise to subjective experience.',
    author: 'David Chalmers',
    source: 'Facing Up to the Problem of Consciousness',
    year: '1995',
    context: 'Articulates the enduring challenge of connecting computation to experience.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Instead of trying to produce a program to simulate the adult mind, why not rather try to produce one which simulates the child\'s?',
    author: 'Alan Turing',
    source: 'Computing Machinery and Intelligence',
    year: '1950',
    context: 'Advocates developmental approaches to artificial intelligence.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Syntax is not semantics.',
    author: 'John Searle',
    source: 'Minds, Brains, and Programs',
    year: '1980',
    context: 'Raises the question of whether symbolic manipulation alone yields understanding.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Brains are not passive organs for representing the world. They are active prediction engines.',
    author: 'Andy Clark',
    source: 'Surfing Uncertainty',
    year: '2016',
    context: 'Frames perception as prediction, echoing how Aggie anticipates human needs.'
  },
  {
    text: 'The mind is what the brain does.',
    author: 'Patricia Churchland',
    source: 'Neurophilosophy',
    year: '1986',
    context: 'Expresses the materialist stance that cognition emerges from neural activity.'
  },
  {
    text: 'You cannot teach a man anything; you can only help him find it within himself.',
    author: 'Galileo Galilei',
    year: 'c. 1630s',
    context: 'Celebrates facilitation over instruction—mirroring participatory AI design.'
  },
  {
    text: 'If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.',
    author: 'Isaac Newton',
    year: '1675',
    context: 'Acknowledges collective knowledge, just as Aggie is built from shared insight.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Consciousness is somehow a by-product of the simultaneous, high frequency firing of neurons in different parts of the brain... like a symphony orchestra.',
    author: 'Francis Crick',
    source: 'The Astonishing Hypothesis',
    year: '1994',
    context: 'Connects neuronal coordination to the emergent quality of awareness.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Memory is everything. Without it we are nothing.',
    author: 'Eric Kandel',
    source: 'In Search of Memory',
    year: '2006',
    context: 'Highlights the primacy of memory in identity and learning.'
  },
  {
    text: 'The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.',
    author: 'W. B. Yeats',
    year: '1921',
    context: 'Invites us to refine perception—critical for attuning AI to human nuance.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Knowledge is the beginning of practice; doing is the completion of knowing.',
    author: 'Wang Yangming',
    source: 'Instructions for Practical Living',
    year: '1527',
    context: 'Unites insight and action—the ethos behind deploying Aggie responsibly.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Start with an open mind, then read one theory... what is right and wrong will become apparent of itself.',
    author: 'Zhu Xi',
    source: 'Conversations of Master Zhu',
    year: '1190',
    context: 'Encourages iterative synthesis of multiple viewpoints.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Do you have the patience to wait till your mud settles and the water is clear? Can you remain unmoving till the right action arises by itself?',
    author: 'Laozi',
    source: 'Tao Te Ching',
    context: 'A call for reflective restraint before acting—essential for high-impact AI decisions.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Brains are prediction machines and bodies are part of the loop.',
    author: 'Andy Clark',
    source: 'Being There',
    year: '1997',
    context: 'Extends embodied cognition, reinforcing that intelligence is situated.'
  },
  {
    text: 'Ignorance leads to fear, fear leads to hatred, and hatred leads to violence. This is the equation.',
    author: 'Averroes (Ibn Rushd)',
    year: '12th century',
    context: 'Connects knowledge to social harmony, underscoring ethical imperatives for AI.'
  },
  {
    text: 'The duty of the man who investigates the writings of scientists... is to make himself an enemy of all that he reads.',
    author: 'Alhazen (Ibn al-Haytham)',
    source: 'Book of Optics',
    year: 'c. 1021',
    context: 'Advocates critical inquiry—mirrored in auditing Aggie\'s outputs.'
  },
  {
    text: 'That which is easiest to grasp and most useful in calculation is what we must seek.',
    author: 'Al-Khwarizmi',
    source: 'The Compendious Book on Calculation',
    year: 'c. 820',
    context: 'Early articulation of algorithmic thinking and usable mathematics.'
  },
  {
    text: 'We must know. We will know.',
    author: 'David Hilbert',
    year: '1930',
    context: 'Captures human resolve to solve complex problems, including safe AGI.'
  },
  {
    text: 'A mathematician is a device for turning coffee into theorems.',
    author: 'Paul Erdős',
    year: '1960s',
    context: 'Playfully celebrates collaborative creation—a nod to Aggie\'s collective builders.'
  },
  {
    text: 'The teacher is a needle, the disciple is as thread. You must practice constantly.',
    author: 'Miyamoto Musashi',
    source: 'The Book of Five Rings',
    year: '1645',
    context: 'Speaks to disciplined, iterative refinement of intelligent systems.'
  }
]
